text: Malik Abdul Basit (November 14, 1972 â€“ July 29, 2020), known by his stage name Malik B., was an American rapper and singer. He founded the hip hop band the Roots.Davis, Kimberly (2003) "The Roots Redefine Hip-Hop's Past", Ebony, June 2003, p. 162Shapiro, Peter (2005) The Rough Guide to Hip-Hop, Rough Guides, , p. 323 He appeared on the first four albums released by the Roots. He returned as a featured artist for some later albums. He released one EP, etitled Psychological, on emcee Haak Blast's publishing company Future Blast Publishing. He also released two studio albums: Street Assault (2005) and Unpredictable (2015) with Mr. Green. Basit was born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Basit died on July 29, 2020 at the age of 47. ==References== Category:1972 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Rappers from Pennsylvania Category:American hip hop musicians Category:Singers from Philadelphia Category:21st-century American rappers
title: Malik B.
